trans-unit.source: Porting to .NET Core from .NET Framework
trans-unit.target: Porting to .NET Core from .NET Framework

trans-unit.source: Porting to .NET Core from .NET Framework
trans-unit.target: Porting to .NET Core from .NET Framework

trans-unit.source: .NET, .NET Core
trans-unit.target: .NET, .NET Core

trans-unit.source: Porting to .NET Core from .NET Framework
trans-unit.target: Porting to .NET Core from .NET Framework

trans-unit.source: If you've got code running on the .NET Framework, you may be interested in running your code on .NET Core 1.0.
trans-unit.target: If you've got code running on the .NET Framework, you may be interested in running your code on .NET Core 1.0.

trans-unit.source: This article covers an overview of the porting process and a list of the tools you may find helpful when porting to .NET Core.
trans-unit.target: This article covers an overview of the porting process and a list of the tools you may find helpful when porting to .NET Core.

trans-unit.source: Overview of the Porting Process
trans-unit.target: Overview of the Porting Process

trans-unit.source: The recommended process for porting follows the following series of steps.
trans-unit.target: The recommended process for porting follows the following series of steps.

trans-unit.source: Each of these parts of the process are covered in more detail in further articles.
trans-unit.target: Each of these parts of the process are covered in more detail in further articles.

trans-unit.source: Identify and account for your third-party dependencies.
trans-unit.target: Identify and account for your third-party dependencies.

trans-unit.source: This will involve understanding what your third-party dependencies are, how you depend on them, how to see if they also run on .NET Core, and steps you can take if they don't.
trans-unit.target: This will involve understanding what your third-party dependencies are, how you depend on them, how to see if they also run on .NET Core, and steps you can take if they don't.

trans-unit.source: Retarget all projects you wish to port to target .NET Framework 4.6.2.
trans-unit.target: Retarget all projects you wish to port to target .NET Framework 4.6.2.

trans-unit.source: This ensures that you can use API alternatives for .NET Framework-specific targets in the cases where .NET Core can't support a particular API.
trans-unit.target: This ensures that you can use API alternatives for .NET Framework-specific targets in the cases where .NET Core can't support a particular API.

trans-unit.source: Use the [API Portability Analyzer tool](https://github.com/Microsoft/dotnet-apiport/blob/master/docs/HowTo/Introduction.md) to analyze your assemblies and develop a plan to port based on its results.
trans-unit.target: Use the [API Portability Analyzer tool](https://github.com/Microsoft/dotnet-apiport/blob/master/docs/HowTo/Introduction.md) to analyze your assemblies and develop a plan to port based on its results.

trans-unit.source: The API Portability Analyzer tool will analyze your compiled assemblies and generate a report which shows a high-level portability summary and a breakdown of each API you're using that isn't available on .NET Core.
trans-unit.target: The API Portability Analyzer tool will analyze your compiled assemblies and generate a report which shows a high-level portability summary and a breakdown of each API you're using that isn't available on .NET Core.

trans-unit.source: You can use this report alongside an analysis of your codebase to develop a plan for how you'll port your code over.
trans-unit.target: You can use this report alongside an analysis of your codebase to develop a plan for how you'll port your code over.

trans-unit.source: Port your tests code.
trans-unit.target: Port your tests code.

trans-unit.source: Because porting to .NET Core is such a big change to your codebase, it's highly recommended to get your tests ported so that you can run tests as you port code over.
trans-unit.target: Because porting to .NET Core is such a big change to your codebase, it's highly recommended to get your tests ported so that you can run tests as you port code over.

trans-unit.source: MSTest, xUnit, and NUnit all support .NET Core 1.0 today.
trans-unit.target: MSTest, xUnit, and NUnit all support .NET Core 1.0 today.

trans-unit.source: Execute your plan for porting!
trans-unit.target: Execute your plan for porting!

trans-unit.source: Tools to help
trans-unit.target: Tools to help

trans-unit.source: Here's a short list of the tools you'll find helpful:
trans-unit.target: Here's a short list of the tools you'll find helpful:

trans-unit.source: NuGet - [Nuget Client](https://dist.nuget.org/index.html) or [NuGet Package Explorer](https://github.com/NuGetPackageExplorer/NuGetPackageExplorer), the package manager for the .NET Platform.
trans-unit.target: NuGet - [Nuget Client](https://dist.nuget.org/index.html) or [NuGet Package Explorer](https://github.com/NuGetPackageExplorer/NuGetPackageExplorer), the package manager for the .NET Platform.

trans-unit.source: Api Portability Analyzer - [command line tool](https://github.com/Microsoft/dotnet-apiport/releases) or [Visual Studio Extension](https://visualstudiogallery.msdn.microsoft.com/1177943e-cfb7-4822-a8a6-e56c7905292b), a toolchain that can generate a report of how portable your code is between .NET Framework and .NET Core, with an assembly-by-assembly breakdown of issues.
trans-unit.target: Api Portability Analyzer - [command line tool](https://github.com/Microsoft/dotnet-apiport/releases) or [Visual Studio Extension](https://visualstudiogallery.msdn.microsoft.com/1177943e-cfb7-4822-a8a6-e56c7905292b), a toolchain that can generate a report of how portable your code is between .NET Framework and .NET Core, with an assembly-by-assembly breakdown of issues.

trans-unit.source: See [Tooling to help you on the process](https://github.com/Microsoft/dotnet-apiport/blob/master/docs/HowTo/Introduction.md) for more information.
trans-unit.target: See [Tooling to help you on the process](https://github.com/Microsoft/dotnet-apiport/blob/master/docs/HowTo/Introduction.md) for more information.

trans-unit.source: Reverse Package Search - A [useful web service](https://packagesearch.azurewebsites.net) that allows you to search for a type and find packages containing that type.
trans-unit.target: Reverse Package Search - A [useful web service](https://packagesearch.azurewebsites.net) that allows you to search for a type and find packages containing that type.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Analyzing your third-party dependencies.
trans-unit.target: Analyzing your third-party dependencies.
